radiographic_examinations.findings: The lungs are clear. Heart size is normal without pericardial effusion. The liver is homogeneous in attenuation without discrete masses or lesions. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The gallbladder, pancreas, and spleen are unremarkable. The bilateral adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable. No hydronephrosis or hydroureter. The bladder is mildly distended and grossly normal. The stomach and small bowel are unremarkable. There is a dilated 11mm hyperemic appendix with a thickened wall. Surrounding inflammatory changes within the mesenteric fat are noted, with no focal fluid collections or evidence of perforation. The mesenteric vein extending from the inflamed appendix is thrombosed, with clot extending into the superior mesenteric vein. Associated misty mesentery and vessel engorgement observed. Multiple prominent mesenteric lymph nodes are present, the largest measuring 1 cm in short axis. No free air or fluid is identified within the abdomen or pelvis. The rectum, prostate, and seminal vesicles are unremarkable. The aorta is of normal caliber. The hepatic, left, right, main portal, and splenic veins are unremarkable. No suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are identified.
